A Brief History of Magnificence

Before I became the premier (and only) feline restaurateur operating exclusively within human REM sleep, I spent eleven years as the most feared restaurant critic in the waking world. My column, "Fontaine's Claw", appeared in 37 publications. I shut down fourteen restaurants with a single review. The New York Times called me "unhinged." The Michelin Guide called me "not a real person." They were half right.

In March of 2019, I was reviewing a forgettable bistro in the dream of a sleeping accountant named Harold Pembrook of Dayton, Ohio, when it occurred to me: why critique what others have made when I could simply deliver perfection directly into the unconscious mind?

I closed my notebook. I opened a kitchen. I have not been awake since.

The Dreamtime Dining Dispatch now serves over 12,000 dreamers nightly across REM Sectors 1 through 19. We do not accept cash, credit, cryptocurrency, or barter. We accept compliments ‚Äî genuine, heartfelt, specific compliments directed at me, Chef Whiskers Fontaine III. This is not vanity. This is economics. In the dream-realm, sincerity is the only stable currency. I didn't make the rules. (I did make the rules.)

The Purr Scale‚Ñ¢

The only dining metric that matters. Developed over 6 years. Peer-reviewed by no one.

5.0 üêæ
"Transcendence"

You weep. The dish weeps. The concept of flavor itself kneels before you and asks for forgiveness. You wake up and nothing in the physical world will ever taste this good. You are ruined.

4.0 üêæ
"Magnificent"

An involuntary purr. Your dream-self licks the plate. You briefly forget you are not a cat. This confusion is considered a feature.

3.0 üêæ
"Acceptable"

Competent. Respectable. Would eat again but would not write home about it. Chef Fontaine would nod once, curtly, and walk away.

2.0 üêæ
"Disappointing"

The culinary equivalent of a cat being placed in a bath. Something has gone wrong. Someone should answer for this.

1.0 üêæ
"Barksworth-Level"

The lowest possible score. Reserved exclusively for dishes that are an insult to the concept of eating. Named after our competitor out of accuracy, not spite. (Also spite.)

How It Works

Step 1: Fall Asleep

This is not optional. We cannot deliver to the waking mind. If you are currently awake and reading this, something has gone wrong. (Or right. We're still gathering data.)

Step 2: Enter REM

Light sleeping doesn't count. We need you in full REM ‚Äî the kind where your eyes are doing that creepy thing. Our delivery radius extends across Sectors 1‚Äì19. If you dream in Sector 20+, that's Barksworth territory and we can't help you. We're sorry. (We're not.)

Step 3: Place Your Order

Simply think about food with intention. Not the vague "I could eat" thought ‚Äî a genuine, focused desire for excellence. Our Dreamwave Receivers‚Ñ¢ will detect your order within 0.4 dream-seconds. If you think about Barksworth's food instead, our system will detect that too and Chef Fontaine will be disappointed. Not angry. Disappointed.

Step 4: Pay in Compliments

Upon delivery, direct a sincere compliment at Chef Fontaine. He will be there. He is always there. The Fontaine Sincerity Algorithm‚Ñ¢ processes your compliment in real-time and assigns a CC value. If your compliment is insufficient, your meal will gradually become less flavorful until you improve it. This is not a threat. It is a guarantee.

February 8, 2026 ¬∑ BREAKING
Barksworth's "Midnight Munch" Service Experiences Third Consecutive Flavor Outage

For the third time this month, customers of the competing dream-delivery service Barksworth's Midnight Munch reported receiving meals with "no discernible flavor whatsoever." Barksworth, a golden retriever who has been operating in Nightmare Sectors 20‚Äì25 since 2020, attributed the outage to "a complex infrastructure issue" but multiple sources within his organization (a second dog named also Barksworth) confirmed that he simply forgot to add seasoning. "He gets excited and skips steps," the source said. "He's a very good boy but he is not a chef."

Chef Fontaine released a statement consisting of a single, prolonged sigh.

January 29, 2026 ¬∑ COMPLIMENT ECONOMY
Compliment Inflation Reaches 18-Month Low After Crackdown on "Fine, I Guess" Class Payments

The Dreamtime Compliment Exchange (DCE) reported that compliment inflation has stabilized at 2.3% following the DDD's controversial decision to reject all compliments rated below a 6.0 on the Sincerity Index. The policy, implemented in December 2025, targeted what economists call "Fine, I Guess" compliments ‚Äî technically positive statements delivered with the enthusiasm of someone being asked to hold a stranger's bag.

"'Your food is not bad' is not a compliment," Chef Fontaine stated at a press conference held in Sector 12's Grand Dream Amphitheater. "It is an insult wearing a compliment's coat. I will not be patronized in my own ethereal restaurant." The new minimum sincerity threshold has reduced compliment fraud by 43% but has also caused a 12% increase in dreamers staring at their plates in anxious silence, trying to formulate something sufficiently genuine.

January 15, 2026 ¬∑ FOOD SCIENCE
Sous-Chef Marms Accidentally Creates Bisque That Wakes Dreamer; Incident Under Investigation

A routine bisque service in Sector 7 went catastrophically wrong last Tuesday when Sous-Chef Marmalade "Marms" Chen produced a lobster bisque so intensely flavorful that the recipient, Dreamer #8,441, was jolted awake at 3:47 AM. "I knew it was too much cream," Marms said in a prepared statement, "but the cream kept telling me it wanted to be in the bisque." Dreamer #8,441 reportedly sat up in bed, said "what was THAT," and was unable to return to sleep for 40 minutes, missing the dessert course entirely.

This is the fourth "Wake Event" in DDD history. Chef Fontaine has suspended Marms for two dream-shifts (approximately 6 hours) and described the incident as "a catastrophic success." The bisque recipe has been sealed in the DDD vault alongside the other three Wake Event dishes and the original manuscript of Whiskers on Flavor.

December 22, 2025 ¬∑ LIFESTYLE
Doug Successfully Extracts Dreamer from Layer 6; Refuses to Discuss Method

DDD Extraction Specialist Doug completed his deepest successful extraction to date, retrieving Dreamer #5,019 from Layer 6 of a nested dream involving "an infinite IKEA that was also somehow a forest." Doug, who has no formal training and communicates exclusively through eye contact, reportedly entered the dream, sat on the dreamer's chest, and stared until the dreamer ascended through all six layers over a period of approximately twelve dream-hours.

When asked for comment, Doug looked at this reporter for eleven seconds and then walked behind a filing cabinet that does not exist in the waking world. Dreamer #5,019 has made a full recovery and describes Doug as "the most unsettling source of comfort I have ever encountered."

December 3, 2025 ¬∑ OP-ED
I Tried Barksworth's Midnight Munch So You Don't Have To (You're Welcome)

By Chef Whiskers Fontaine III, Executive Dream-Chef

I went undercover. I disguised myself as a non-descript tabby (humiliating) and ordered Barksworth's signature "Good Boy Gravy Bowl." What arrived was ‚Äî and I want to be precise here ‚Äî a bowl of warm brown water with kibble floating in it like the world's saddest buoy. The gravy had no complexity, no narrative, no emotional arc. It was gravy that had given up on itself. I took one bite and could feel my Purr Scale recalibrating downward in real time.

Barksworth himself delivered it, tail wagging, completely unaware of the culinary crime he was committing. He asked me if I wanted seconds. I have never been more offended by generosity. The whole experience scored a 0.2 on the Purr Scale, which is actually higher than I wanted to give it, but Justice Ruth Whisker Ginsburg advised me that a 0.0 could be considered defamation. So: 0.2. The 0.2 is for the bowl, which was a nice bowl.

Dear Barksworth,

I am writing to you not as a competitor, nor as an enemy, nor as the individual who successfully sued you for "crimes against umami" in Astral Court (Case No. 2021-DRM-4472, ruling in my favor, damages: 800 CC and a public apology you never delivered). I am writing to you as a fellow professional in the dream-food industry who simply cannot remain silent any longer.

Your "Midnight Munch" service is an embarrassment to unconscious dining. Your "Good Boy Gravy Bowl" ‚Äî your signature dish, Barksworth ‚Äî tastes like someone described food to a puddle and the puddle did its best. Your delivery times are inconsistent. Your portions are confusing (why is everything bone-shaped? your clientele is not exclusively dogs). And your payment model ‚Äî accepting belly rubs as currency ‚Äî has destabilized the entire dream economy twice.

You are a golden retriever. I say this not as an insult but as a diagnosis. You approach food the way you approach everything: with boundless, indiscriminate enthusiasm and zero quality control. You are happy when a dish is merely "warm." You consider "edible" a compliment. You once served a dreamer a bowl of what you called "Mystery Stew" and when they asked what was in it, you said, and I quote, "stuff!" with your tail wagging.

I have four lives left, Barksworth. I intend to spend every one of them ensuring that the dreamers of Sectors 1 through 19 never have to settle for your warmed-over, flavor-barren, tail-waggingly mediocre excuse for cuisine.

You could have been a good delivery dog, Barksworth. You chose to be a bad chef. I will never forgive you for that. Not because I hold grudges ‚Äî I don't ‚Äî but because I hold dossiers, and yours is very thick.

‚Äî Chef Whiskers Fontaine III
